posts.post_content:
@Eternal\_Blue I think lorendorky might know about [Hearth Charm](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Hearth Charm) (or even [Scare Tactics](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Scare Tactics)).  
Hearth Charm is a far more wordy multiple-choice card. While you are right, that this is pretty much the better choice in eternal formats, it's not strictly better either. (It affects attacking creatures, which does make a difference if you have something like [Spikeshot Goblin](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Spikeshot Goblin) or want to cast this card during your opponent's turn for some reason. Or if you're playing 2HG.)  
  
What he was merely getting at was his surprise how this particular effect hasn't been printed yet after all the years. He has a point, i could easily imagine a card as simple as that (possibly even with that particular name) in one of the earliest Sets.  
  
My guess is that this will see occational reprint in upcoming Core Sets...  
  
I also think it still deserves more than a rating below 1.9 (12 votes as of now). With a little swarm of creatures this can make quite a diff... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

Or if you're playing 2HG.)

What he was merely getting at was his surprise how this particular effect hasn't been printed yet after all the years. He has a point, i could easily imagine a card as simple as that (possibly even with that particular name) in one of the earliest Sets.

Posted By: Mode (4/29/2012 5:22:40 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Not a great card by any means, but it went a long way in my wins at the prerelease. Casting [Thatcher Revolt](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Thatcher Revolt) then this (with other creatures already on the field) really helped me take chunks out of opponents' life totals.  
  
I'd rate the art a 3/5 and the flavor (not just the flavor text, but how it fits within the story of AVR) a 4/5. The effect fits in red's slice of the color pie, the price is right, but it probably won't see much if any serious constructed play. 3/5 overall.
posts.html:
Not a great card by any means, but it went a long way in my wins at the prerelease. Casting Thatcher Revolt then this (with other creatures already on the field) really helped me take chunks out of opponents' life totals.

I'd rate the art a 3/5 and the flavor (not just the flavor text, but how it fits within the story of AVR) a 4/5. The effect fits in red's slice of the color pie, the price is right, but it probably won't see much if any serious constructed play. 3/5 overall.

Rating:

posts.post_content:
I have trouble believing how low this card is rated. Yes, it isn't reds finest, but in any kind of token-spamming deck, it can be brutal. At the very least, if you get through three unblocked creatures, it's the same as a [Lightning Bolt](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Lightning Bolt)- 3 damage for R. If you're running tokens and can't manage three or more unblocked creatures, either you're playing against another token deck or you aren't playing your deck right.  
  
4/5

Posted By: Salient (12/30/2012 11:02:13 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
This is not even worth a card, just add a creature with battlecry, it's not hard, seriously. This is not what any deck wants, even if it was put on a stick. The only constructed play this card will see is as a proxy. It's barely even playable in limited ... Now if it was +2+0, that would be a limited card! But, no, no, too broken. \*sigh\* They should have tried to make it at least playable as a 13th pick. Drafting red in m13 had 3 easy to get chase cards. [Goblin Arsonist](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Goblin Arsonist), [Krenko's Command](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Krenko's Command), and [Arms Dealer](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Arms Dealer), if you curved correctly into that, it was game over. This card just makes no sense. Maybe run this with [Odric, Master Tactician](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Odric, Master Tactician) in limited? I don't know, I'm trying here ... this card is terrible.  
  
0.5/5
